definition: to explain/to release/Buddha (abbr. for 釋迦牟尼|释迦牟尼[Shi4 jia1 mou2 ni2])/Buddhism

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: We'll keep you posted on developments with this one as it nears its release date.
sentences.chinese: 我们将保留您的留言于开发上和接近释出游戏时。

sentences.english: And given the opportunity to dissipate potential energy, these channels will slowly spread.
sentences.chinese: 一旦有机会释出位能，这些通道会缓慢扩张。

sentences.english: I saw one in Akihabara yesterday for twice the RRP .
sentences.chinese: 我看到一个在秋叶原昨天两倍释出。

sentences.english: Through pyrolysis , Hg and pyrolytic vapor will be reliefed from organic samples.
sentences.chinese: 生物样品经高温热解，汞及大量热解气体一同释出。

sentences.english: A reasonable request. For the next major release, we have to do something about this limitation.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须在下个大版本释出时做点事情来解决此限制。

sentences.english: Release the medicine by pushing on the plunger.
This build 7264 has confirmed to be legitimate.
sentences.chinese: 版本7264已确定正式释出，如下图。

sentences.english: Soak disposable chopstick in hot water before use to release carbon dioxide.
sentences.chinese: 宜先用热水浸泡，时间越久二氧化硫释出越多。

sentences.english: Releases resources associated with this object.
sentences.chinese: 释出与这个物件相关联的资源。

sentences.english: Huge amount of carbon could be coming out of the world.
sentences.chinese: 世界上大量的碳都会释出。

sentences.english: The sauna is supposed to emit radiation in the infrared part of the spectrum, which adjoins the microwave spectrum.
sentences.chinese: 这种机器应该会释出光谱中临近微波的红外线。

sentences.english: The default theme has received some attention since last release and comes in light and dark versions.
sentences.chinese: 自从上一版本释出后，默认的主题去年以来极受关注。

sentences.english: As coal burns, it releases traces of mercury that waft out of smokestacks .
sentences.chinese: 煤燃烧时所释出微量的汞会飘出烟囱。

sentences.english: One-half of physicians were not satisfied with the policy pertaining to the approval of prescription refills.
sentences.chinese: 五成以上基层医师表达对于慢笺释出制度不满意。

sentences.english: It binds phosphate far stronger than most other PAM and does not leach back out even after the full adsorption capacity is reached.
sentences.chinese: 当其容量的吸收已达到最高点时，也不会释出还原。

sentences.english: C burning gasoline would evolve more energy than that of gasohol .
sentences.chinese: 燃烧汽油较酒精汽油释出较大的能量。

definition: to shift resources into areas of need/to inject funds/to balance resources
to be separated (from a friend, one's homeland etc) for a period of time/after a hiatus of (x years)
to respond accordingly to/to adapt to/to cope with
